A)(Circulated "by the Secretary of State for the C&lcmies,)PARAPHRASE TELEGRAM from the High Commissioner of Iraq to the Secretary of State for the Colonies *(Received Colonial Office 9.40 -p.m. 27th November, 1921.Dated 25th November. '..**.*..*Further to my telegram dated November 20th No.700 regarding hostile Intentions of Turkey. It is reported by Inspector General of Levies that during last five ? days there is a marked endeavour on the part of ex-officers and men of Turkish array other than Iraqis to get enlisted In levies. Of such ex-officers speaking Turkish only but styling themselves Kurds ? sixteen have applied for commissions and twenty out of twenty six men. In the same connection it should be noted that loss of sixty three rifles in first battalion of.levies of which nineteen have been recovered is attrAbated zo. an ex-Turkish officer and Turkish chaoush who had managed to get enrolled. In future special care wili be taken.to see,that applicants of this category are rejected,,COX,
